remarks: Series product with an upper integer index set (i.e. an infinite product.)  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 5-Dec-2017.)
statement:
zprod.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
zprod.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
zprod.3 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. Z E. y ( y =/= 0 /\ seq n ( x. , F ) ~~> y ) ) $.
iprod.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = B ) $.
iprod.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> B e. CC ) $.
iprod $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. Z B = ( ~~> ` seq M ( x. , F ) ) ) $.
$d B n y $.
$d F k $.
$d M k y $.
$d Z k n y $.
$d k n ph y $.
